title: FIFA suspends Blatter, Platini for 90 days over criminal case
text:

(FABRICE COFFRINI/AFP/Getty Images) FIFA suspends Blatter, Platini for 90 days over criminal case Zurich — The Associated Press 
Thursday, Oct. 08, 2015 8:04AM EDT 
Last updated Thursday, Oct. 08, 2015 8:33AM EDT 
Sepp Blatter and UEFA President Michel Platini, the man who had been favoured to take over as FIFA leader, were both suspended for 90 days Thursday, plunging soccer’s governing body deeper into crisis. 
Blatter and Platini were suspended by the FIFA ethics committee in the wake of a Swiss criminal investigation. The decision seemingly ends Platini’s bid to succeed Blatter as FIFA president in the emergency election in February. connect with us The Globe and Mail Newspaper
